job_description: Athletic Part-time Sports Statistician - job post University of North Texas 765 reviews Denton, TX 76203 Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Department UNT-Athletic Admin-Gen-220000 Job Location Denton Full Time/Part Time Part-Time Pay Rate Salary Information Department Summary UNT competes as a member of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) and C-USA. North Texas’ athletic programs are classified as NCAA Division I, the largest and highest division among all colleges and universities. The 46,000 square-foot Athletic Center located off South Bonnie Brae Street is the centerpiece of North Texas athletics. Athletics strives to conduct a competitive athletics program that promotes faculty, staff, student and community affiliation and participation with North Texas Athletics. Also, to provide facilities which attract the highest level of talent and allow student athletes to perform at the highest level in practice and in competition. Position Summary Hourly paid employee who will substitute on game days of various North Texas sporting events for official NCAA statistical help using various statistical inputting programs. Must be able to work weekends and nights. Must have understanding of sports and must have experience using programs. Must be able to work under stressful circumstances. Additional Posting Details Minimum Qualifications The successful candidate will possess a High School diploma or GED equivalent. Preferred Qualifications Must have understanding of sports and must have experience using programs. Required License / Registration / Certification Work Schedule Monday through Friday, with some evenings and week-ends Driving University Vehicle No Security Sensitive This is a security sensitive position. AI/ML Engineer - Level 3 - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Fort Worth, TX 76108 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time We Are Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. What’s In It For You 3 day weekends every weekend!! From comprehensive benefits to investing in your future and security,Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package here. Who We Are This exciting position is with the Mission Control Systems Team supporting the Advanced Software team located in Fort Worth, Texas. This position is for an experienced Engineer to use and apply technical standards, principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in the Artificial Intelligence and software field to develop solutions to complex problems within Advanced Development Programs (ADP). What You Will Be Doing You will focus on the of products that implement to provide discriminating Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies/capability to our customers. This will require engagement in every phase of the system lifecycle including requirements generation, system and design, implementation, integration, and flight test. Activities will range from proof of concepts, of prototypes, building demonstrators, and transition to production. The candidate will help to shape R&D opportunities (CRAD, CRADA, internal/external collaborations) with a focus on customer science and technology organizations, such as DARPA, AFRL or ONR. Key Responsibilities Collaborating with a multi-disciplinary team including program management, advanced concepts, advanced systems, special projects, and external customers. Drive the design and development of key technologies within the scope and realm of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Apply new and existing technologies in a dynamic fast paced environment. Up to 10% travel, primarily domestic may be required. Must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time and interpersonal skills. ****Interim Secret clearance required with ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance**** Fort Worth, TX This position is in Fort Worth, TX Discover Fort Worth. EngineeringAeronautics AeroSoftware aerocombatsystems AeroHiringBlitz Basic Qualifications: BS in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Physics, or other Science related discipline with course work in AI/ML Experience developing software using Python and C++ Professional experience with AI, ML, and/or data science technologies Up to 10% travel required, primarily domestic ****Interim Secret clearance required with ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance**** Desired Skills: Active Top Secret clearance MS in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or Engineering with a focus / thesis in AI/ML Experience developing models using supervised, unsupervised, or reinforcement learning techniques Experience with probability and statistics Experience with integration of software (or models) onto embedded single board computers Familiarity with any of these; Computer Vision, Path planning and obstacle avoidance, Anomaly detection, RF signal processing and Specialty sensing and communications hardware”, (i.e software defined radios, EO/IR cameras, etc… Familiarity with large scale software and system architecture and design Experience with DevOps tools: Docker, Git [GitLab, GitHub], BitBucket, Continuous Integration [CI], Continuous Deployment [CD] Experience developing applications on Linux Experience developing on cloud architectures (i.e. AWS) Knowledge of Agile Principles and Frameworks Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges.
